title: A Comparative Evaluation of Deep Learning Models for Speech Enhancement in Real-World Noisy Environments
author: Md Jahangir Alam Khondkar (Clarkson University), Ajan Ahmed (Clarkson University), Masudul Haider Imtiaz (Clarkson University), Stephanie Schuckers (Clarkson University), ...
relevance_why: The paper evaluates advanced deep learning models for speech enhancement, a key area in Haohe Liu's research on audio processing. It provides insights into noise suppression and speaker recognition, which can inform future work on speech restoration and generation.
background: This paper analyzes the performance of various deep learning models used for enhancing speech signals by reducing noise in real-world scenarios.
contribution: This study introduces a benchmark comparison of three state-of-the-art models—Wave-U-Net, CMGAN, and U-Net—to tackle speech enhancement challenges in noisy environments, achieving significant improvements in signal quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often limited their evaluations to datasets used during training, neglecting the impact of varied real-world noise conditions.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes diverse evaluation datasets and incorporates speaker recognition metrics, thus providing a more comprehensive assessment of the models' practical applicability.

key_innovation: The research systematically compares models under standardized conditions, revealing important trade-offs among noise suppression, perceptual quality, and speaker recognition retention.
real_world_impact: Enhancements in speech quality can significantly improve applications in telecommunications, voice biometrics, and forensic audio analysis in noisy environments.
limitations: No specific limitations of the models were discussed in detail.
